CE 3372 Water Systems Design

Catalog Description

3372. Water Systems Design (3:3:0). Prerequisite: CE 3305, 3354. Hydraulic analysis and design of municipal water distribution, stormwater collection, and wastewater collection systems. Oral and written presentations. (Communication Intensive)

Stormwater Collection Hydraulics - Gradually Varied Flow

Lesson examines open conduit flow concepts for gradually varied flow (slope HGL != slope EGL) flow as it pertains to the hydraulics of collection systems.

Lesson Notes   Instructor notes used in face-to-face presentation.

Open Channel Flow Roberson, J.A., Cassidy, J.J., and Chaudry, M.H. (1988) Closed Conduits in "Hydraulic Engineering." Houghton Mifflin Co. pp. 240-310.

Basic Hydraulic Principles of Open-Channel Flow Harvey E. Jobson and David E. Froelich, U.S. Geological Survey Open-File Report 88-707, 1988.

Urban Stormwater Manglement Wurbs, R.A., and James, W. P. (2002) Water Resources Engineering, Prentice Hall; pp.622-638.
